intro: Barrotia tetrodon, commonly known as the four-tooth barrotia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
